metadata.description: RavDevOps website and public GitHub knowledge base for chatbot static lookup.

entries.title: About RavDevOps
questions: What is RavDevOps?
Who is Raven Development Operations?
Tell me about Raven Development.
What does RavDevOps do?
entries.answer: Raven Development Operations (RavDevOps) is a veteran-owned US shop doing fractional DevOps and custom software for small businesses. We strip waste, automate delivery, and give teams clear timelines so they ship faster with fewer outages.

entries.title: Location
questions: Where is RavDevOps located?
What city is Raven Development in?
Are you based in Kansas City?
entries.answer: We are based in Kansas City, Missouri, USA.

entries.title: Services Overview (High Level)
questions: What services do you offer?
What problems does RavDevOps solve?
How can you help my business?
entries.answer: Our core lane is fractional DevOps: part-time or project help to modernize pipelines and releases. Typical work includes GitHub Actions CI/CD, preview deploys, safer rollouts, plus custom web apps or bots when needed.

entries.title: List of Core Services
questions: What services does RavDevOps offer?
List your services.
What kind of DevOps work do you do?
entries.answer: We offer DevOps Assessment & Roadmap, CI/CD Pipelines & Automation, Infrastructure as Code & Cloud, Observability & Reliability, Dev Environment & Tooling, and Custom Software Development.

entries.title: What is Fractional DevOps?
questions: What is fractional DevOps?
How does fractional DevOps work?
What does fractional DevOps mean at RavDevOps?
entries.answer: Fractional DevOps means you get an experienced DevOps partner without hiring full-time. We design or fix pipelines, automate builds and deploys, and coach your team to own it afterward.

entries.title: Who RavDevOps Works With
questions: Who do you work with?
What kinds of customers do you serve?
Do you focus on small businesses?
entries.answer: We mostly help small businesses and entrepreneurs, plus online communities. KC roots with a local event report, and we also support gaming clans with bots and web apps.

entries.title: GitHub Organization
questions: Do you have open source projects?
Where can I see your code?
What is your GitHub organization?
entries.answer: Our public GitHub org is https://github.com/raven-dev-ops. You will see this website, sample e-commerce frontend/backend, Helldivers 2 projects, and other public-but-proprietary repos.

entries.title: ravdevops_demo_website
questions: What is the ravdevops_demo_website?
How is the RavDevOps website built?
What tech stack powers ravdevops.com?
entries.answer: The ravdevops_demo_website repo powers ravdevops.com ? a React/Vite marketing site for our fractional DevOps services.

entries.title: Discord Focus
questions: Do you build Discord bots?
Do you help with Discord communities?
What kind of Discord work does RavDevOps do?
entries.answer: Yes, Discord work is a core lane. We build bots and integrations that drive engagement, stats, leaderboards, and marketplace-style tools for communities.

entries.title: Discord Development Team
questions: Are you a Discord development team?
Do you specialize in Discord tools?
How do you describe your Discord work?
entries.answer: We act as a Discord development team: bots, integrations, and web apps that sync roles, stats, leaderboards, and community workflows.

entries.title: Helldivers 2 Discord Bot
questions: What is the Helldivers 2 Discord bot project?
Tell me about your Helldivers 2 bot.
What does the Helldivers 2 LFG and mission-stats bot do?
entries.answer: Helldivers 2 LFG and mission-stats bot: players upload scoreboard screenshots, OCR turns them into stats, leaderboards and medals update automatically, with LFG pings and utilities.

entries.title: Galactic Phantom Division Website
questions: What is the Galactic Phantom Division website?
What is the Helldivers 2 clan website project?
Tell me about your Helldivers 2 clan site.
entries.answer: Galactic Phantom Division site: Discord auth and roles, leaderboards, merch, profile pages, rotating alerts, and webhooks for stats. Public to view but not for reuse without permission.

entries.title: E-Commerce Backend
questions: What is the e-commerce backend project?
How is your example e-commerce backend built?
Do you have a backend for online stores?
entries.answer: E-commerce backend with APIs for products, carts, orders, payments, reviews, and users. Designed to plug into payment providers and ERPs; public to view under a proprietary license.

entries.title: Art Bay E-Commerce Frontend
questions: What is the Art Bay frontend?
What does the e-commerce frontend project do?
How does your example storefront work?
entries.answer: Art Bay frontend: storefront for a marketplace API with auth, checkout, profiles, addresses, and orders. Public repo with a custom non-commercial license; no forks without permission.

entries.title: RavDevOps KCMO Event Report
questions: What is the RavDevOps KCMO Event Report?
Do you cover Kansas City business events?
Where can I find your KCMO event updates?
entries.answer: RavDevOps KCMO Event Report is a newsletter that rounds up Kansas City events and resources for entrepreneurs and small businesses.

entries.title: How to Contact RavDevOps
questions: How can I contact RavDevOps?
How do I work with you?
Where can I get more information?
entries.answer: Reach us at https://ravdevops.com, see projects at https://github.com/raven-dev-ops, or use the contact links and LinkedIn.

entries.title: DevOps Assessment & Roadmap
questions: What is included in the DevOps Assessment and Roadmap service?
What is your DevOps audit?
How do you assess our DevOps maturity?
entries.answer: DevOps Assessment & Roadmap audits CI/CD, infra, observability, and ops, then delivers a prioritized, executive-ready roadmap with quick wins and a plan.

entries.title: CI/CD Pipelines & Automation
questions: What is included in the CI/CD Pipelines and Automation service?
Can you set up CI/CD for us?
What do you do for GitHub Actions pipelines?
entries.answer: CI/CD Pipelines & Automation: GitHub Actions pipelines for tests, lint, container builds, and zero-downtime deploys with rollback and policy-backed quality gates.

entries.title: Infrastructure as Code & Cloud
questions: What is included in the Infrastructure as Code and Cloud service?
Can you help with Terraform and cloud?
Do you manage secrets and cloud security?
entries.answer: Infrastructure as Code & Cloud: Terraform and cloud hardening with least-privilege access, secrets management, and repeatable environments from dev through prod.

entries.title: Observability & Reliability
questions: What is included in the Observability and Reliability service?
Can you help with logging and metrics?
Do you tune dashboards and alerts?
entries.answer: Observability & Reliability: logging, metrics, and traces with SLO-based alerts, tuned dashboards, and runbooks for faster detection and response.

entries.title: Dev Environment & Tooling
questions: What is included in the Dev Environment and Tooling service?
Can you improve our developer experience?
Do you set up linting and testing?
entries.answer: Dev Environment & Tooling: speed up developer experience with consistent local environments, pre-commit plus CI lint/tests, and workflows that cut review friction.

entries.title: Custom Software Development
questions: What is included in the Custom Software Development service?
Do you build custom web apps?
Can you replace our spreadsheets with tools?
entries.answer: Custom Software Development: web apps, APIs, and internal tools that replace spreadsheets and manual scripts, with automation and integrations around real processes.

entries.title: CI/CD Kickstart Pricing
questions: What is the CI/CD Kickstart engagement and how much does it cost?
How much is your CI/CD Kickstart?
Can you describe the CI/CD Kickstart?
entries.answer: CI/CD Kickstart: fixed-scope pipeline setup or repair for one service (for example Next.js or Django). Starts at $2,400 and includes tests/lint, secrets hardening, and zero-downtime deploy with rollback.

entries.title: DevOps Modernization Sprint Pricing
questions: What is the DevOps Modernization Sprint and how much does it cost?
How much is your DevOps Modernization Sprint?
Can you describe the modernization sprint?
entries.answer: DevOps Modernization Sprint: assessment plus 2?3 week implementation across pipelines, infra, and observability. Starts at $7,600 and delivers a roadmap with concrete upgrades.

entries.title: FAQ: Which Engagement Is Right?
questions: Which engagement is right for my team?
Should I choose CI/CD Kickstart or the modernization sprint?
How do I pick between your offerings?
entries.answer: Pick Kickstart for one pipeline. Choose the Modernization Sprint for a broader refresh across infra, observability, and delivery. Go Fractional DevOps Partner if you want ongoing embedded help.

entries.title: FAQ: Can We Start Small?
questions: Can we start small before committing long term?
Do you offer a smaller pilot?
Can we test things before a big engagement?
entries.answer: Yes. Start small with an assessment or Kickstart, then extend into a sprint or fractional plan once you see results.

entries.title: FAQ: Working With Our Existing Stack
questions: Do you work with our existing tools and stack?
Can you support our current platform?
Do you only use your own tools?
entries.answer: We work with your stack: GitHub Actions, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Heroku, Netlify, AWS, Azure, and JS/TS/Python/Node. We confirm fit on a discovery call.

entries.title: FAQ: Contracts, Invoicing, and Payment Terms
questions: What about contracts, invoicing, and payment terms?
How do you handle billing?
What are your payment terms?
entries.answer: Work is scoped with a short proposal or SOW. Fixed projects are typically 50% up front and 50% on delivery. Fractional partnerships are billed monthly with quarterly scope check-ins.

entries.title: Offline Mode Behavior
questions: What happens if you are offline?
How do you respond in offline mode?
Do you still answer when the assistant is down?
entries.answer: If I am offline, I use a short built-in knowledge base so you still get concise answers about services, pricing, and how to contact or schedule.

entries.title: How to Schedule a Call
questions: How do I schedule a call?
Can you send a Calendly link?
How do I book time?
entries.answer: Use the Schedule buttons or the Calendly embed on the Contact page. If you ask here, I can drop the scheduling link too.

entries.title: Response Time
questions: How fast do you respond?
When will I hear back?
What is your SLA?
entries.answer: Contact form or Calendly bookings get a response within one business day. Fractional partners get faster help via Slack or Teams.

entries.title: Security and Privacy
questions: How do you handle security?
Do you protect credentials?
What about privacy?
entries.answer: We follow least-privilege access, keep secrets in managed stores, and avoid leaving credentials in repos. Share sensitive details over secure channels, not plain chat.

entries.title: Tech Stack Fit
questions: Do you support our stack?
Which languages do you use?
Can you work with Next.js or Django?
entries.answer: Common stacks include Next.js/React, Django/Flask, and Node/Express. Clouds: AWS, Azure, GCP, Netlify, Heroku. We adapt to your tooling.

entries.title: Industries and Teams
questions: Who do you work with?
Do you help SaaS or e-commerce?
Do you support gaming communities?
entries.answer: We help SaaS and B2B teams, e-commerce shops, and online communities including gaming clans that need bots, web apps, or delivery help.
